item.title: UK’s Zapp EV plans to expand globally with an early start in India
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Zapp is launching its urban electric two-wheeler in India in 2025 as it plans to expand globally.

item.description:

item.title: MatPat, the first big YouTuber to successfully exit his company, is lobbying for creators on Capitol Hill
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Though MatPat retired from YouTube, he’s still pretty busy. In fact, he’s been spending a lot of time on Capitol Hill.

item.description:

item.title: Autonomous delivery startup Nuro is gearing up for a comeback
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
The California Department of Motor Vehicles this week granted Nuro approval to test its third-generation R3 autonomous delivery vehicle in four Bay Area cities, giving the AV startup a positive boost after facing some setbacks and financial struggles. The approval gives Nuro the ability to test its driverless delivery vehicle in Mountain View, Palo Alto, […]

item.title: Ghostery’s CEO says regulation won’t save us from ad trackers
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
With Ghostery turning 15 years old this month, TechCrunch caught up with CEO Jean-Paul Schmetz to discuss the company's strategy and the state of ad tracking.

item.title: Apple reaches its first contract agreement with a US retail union
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Two years ago, workers at an Apple Store in Towson, Maryland were the first to establish a formally recognized union at an Apple retail store in the United States. Now they’re the first to reach a tentative contract agreement. According to the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers’ Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, which […]

item.title: OpenAI comes for Google with SearchGPT
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall
item.description:
OpenAI is testing SearchGPT, a new AI search experience to compete directly with Google. The feature aims to elevate search queries with “timely answers” from across the internet and allows the user to ask follow-up questions. The temporary prototype is currently only available to a small group of users and its publisher partners for testing […]

item.title: WazirX to ‘socialize’ $230 million security breach loss among customers
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Indian cryptocurrency exchange WazirX announced on Saturday a controversial plan to “socialize” the $230 million loss from its recent security breach among all its customers, a move that has sent shockwaves through the local crypto community. The Mumbai-based firm, which suspended all trading activities on its platform last week following the cyber attack that compromised […]

item.title: NIST releases a tool for testing AI model risk
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), the U.S. Commerce Department agency that develops and tests tech for the U.S. government, companies and the broader public, has re-released a testbed designed to measure how malicious attacks — particularly attacks that “poison” AI model training data — might degrade the performance of an AI system. […]

item.title: Max Space reinvents expandable habitats with a 17th-century twist, launching in 2026
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Max Space's expandable habitats promise to be larger, stronger, and more versatile than anything like them ever launched, not to mention cheaper and lighter by far than a solid, machined structure.

item.title: Stripe acquires payment processing startup Lemon Squeezy
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
Payments giant Stripe has acquired a four-year-old competitor, Lemon Squeezy, the latter company announced Friday. Terms of the deal were not disclosed. As a merchant of record, Lemon Squeezy calculates and pays global sales tax for digital products, handling legal processing and fees in every country. It primarily serves SaaS and software businesses. In a […]

item.description:

item.title: TikTok rolls out a new feature that lets you find songs by singing or humming them

item.description:

item.title: Alphabet X spinoff partners with Arc’teryx to bring ‘everyday’ exoskeleton to market
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Skip, a wearable tech startup that began as a secretive project inside Alphabet, exited stealth this week to announce a partnership with outdoor clothing specialist Arc’teryx. The deal is the first to bring Skip’s technology to market: “powered pants” that utilize a soft exoskeleton. The tech, called MO/GO, short for “mountain goat,” is a hybrid […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Microsoft brings more generative AI to Bing
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Bing is the latest search engine to introduce generative AI into its results, with Microsoft announcing that it’s making Bing generative search available to a small percentage of users. The goal is to give those users the answers they want right in their search results, potentially synthesizing information that they’d otherwise have to click through […]
